column20: Proper Form

column4: Instep to instep; point toward throw.
column19: Instep to instep; point toward throw.
column20: Stay low; replace feet quickly without crossing. Keep momentum moving toward the target.

column4: Kick throwing foot instep over glove.
column19: Kick throwing foot instep over glove.
column20: Drive back foot through the ball's location to create direction and power for the throw.

column4: Instep to ball; move around ball.
column19: Instep to ball; move around ball.
column20: Step to the side of the ball to create an angle that leads your body toward first base.

column4: Backhand; glove foot steps with ball.
column19: Backhand; glove foot steps with ball.
column20: Sync glove foot landing with the ball entering the glove to "jam" momentum for a quick stop.

column4: Opening hips to reach wide lateral.
column19: Opening hips to reach wide lateral.
column20: Pivot on lead foot and open hips 90° to track balls deep in the hole or gap.
Replace feet in the air turning toward the glove side. Land balanced and ready to fire.
Replace feet while turning toward the hand side (spin). Stay low to maintain balance.

column4: Full arm path; thumb to thigh circle.
column19: Full arm path; thumb to thigh circle.
column20: Break hands at midsection; thumb circles down toward thigh for full extension and power.

column4: Shortened arc; thumb to waist snap.
column19: Shortened arc; thumb to waist snap.
column20: Keep ball above waist. Rapid elbow extension with a heavy wrist flick for quick release.
Pull ball straight back to the ear. Elbow stays high and the path stays extremely short.
Lower arm slot by tilting the torso. Useful for throwing under or around runners.
No arm circle. Use purely the forearm and fingers for extremely close-range plays.

column4: Maintaining a linear line on run.
column20: Track ball in a straight line; avoid "drifting" or "curving" toward the hop.
Round the ball to get your momentum moving back toward the target (first base).
Lead with glove foot, stay low, and keep your nose behind the glove.
Back of the hand faces target. Flick the wrist without a full arm swing.

column4: Stiff wrist, palm to target; flat.
column19: Stiff wrist, palm to target; flat.
column20: Follow ball toward target with palm open. Do not "hook" or roll the wrist.
Stay low and use a bowling motion. Release the ball out front for better accuracy.

column4: Flick ball directly out of glove.
column19: Flick ball directly out of glove.
column20: Keep hand outside the glove. Use the pocket's tension to propel the ball.
Field ball out front. Bring it to the "midline" (chest) before separating hands.

column4: Lead with glove; attack the hop.
column19: Lead with glove; attack the hop.
column20: Don't wait for the ball. Lead with glove and "push" through the hop to the chest.
Keep wrist soft. Push glove "through" the ball right as it leaves the ground.

column19: Dropping to slide to stop ball.
column20: Lead with glove, slide on outer thigh. Keep bare hand ready to cover the ball.

column4: Dropping to slide to stop ball.
column19: Bare hand down; eyes behind glove.
column20: Use bare hand on ground for balance. Get eyes as close to the glove as possible.

column4: Bare hand down; eyes behind glove.
column20: Catch ball over throwing shoulder to transition into the throw immediately.

column19: Point toe; no false steps deep.
column20: First move is directional. Push off the front foot and open the hip toward the ball.

column4: Point toe; no false steps deep.
column20: Run to a spot, look back at the last second. Catch at full stride without jumping.
Explosive first step crossover. Maintain a low center of gravity while accelerating.

column19: Bent leg slide or full extension.
column20: Tuck one leg under, extend the other. Reach for ball at the "highest" point of the slide.

column4: Bent leg slide or full extension.
column20: Use non-glove hand to find fence to gauge distance; track ball at its apex.
Use "bill of the cap" to shield sun. Circle under the ball and catch high.
Pivot hard on back foot instep. Get feet set before the hands separate to throw.

column19: Shifting body to center dirt ball.
column20: Drop to both knees, tuck chin, and "surround" ball with chest. Knees out wide.

column4: Shifting body to center dirt ball.
column20: Drive through heels. Explode hips and "catch" bar on shoulders in front rack.
Wide grip. Explode from floor and punch the bar toward the ceiling in one move.
Keep chest up and weight on mid-foot. Drive knees out as you descend.
Bar sits on deltoids. Keep elbows high to prevent the bar from rolling forward.
Hips locked in extension. Lower torso as slowly as possible using hamstrings.
Keep hips level and front knee tracked over toe. Control the descent.
Chest up, back foot on bench. Drive straight up through the front heel.
Lean slightly forward for balance. Touch back knee to floor softly.

column19: Hinge at hips; target post. chain.
column20: Flat back. Lower weights until a stretch is felt in hamstrings, then squeeze glutes.

column4: Hinge at hips; target post. chain.
column20: Bench at mid-back. Drive hips to ceiling; pause and squeeze at the top.
Land in a quarter-squat with "quiet" feet. Stand up fully to complete rep.

column4: Jump onto high box; land soft.
column20: Use hips to generate power. Release with full arm extension and follow-through.
Shoulders back and down. Take short, fast steps while keeping core braced.
Full range of motion. Slow eccentric (lowering) to build tendon strength.
Squeeze glutes and core. Do not let lower back sag or hips rise too high.
Catch ball and "hold." Work ball toward center of zone with minimal movement.
Turn thumb down or up based on ball height. Stay low and sweep toward the bag.

column4: Tag for throws over right shoulder.
column20: Let the runner's momentum provide the force. Wrap the glove around the leg.

column4: Tag for throws over left shoulder.
column20: Drop knee to block runner's path to the bag. Apply tag and immediately stand.
Reach as far as possible, tag lead foot, and pull glove back to avoid a kick.

column18: Would you like me to create a personalized training schedule using these exercises to help you prepare for your next season?
